title: How are synthetic elements considered elements? - Quora

response.answer_text: If the synthesized element approaches to the qualities of elements means have electrons protons neutrons, and a form means gas liquid or solid phase then it can be called element. No doubt its not natural like gold calcium etc. But we can call it an element.
If they have protons, neutrons, and electrons, that qualifies them as elements. If the number of protons does not equal the number of electrons, then they are also ions.
Synthetic = man made Element = photons + neutrons + electrons If man makes an element, the structure is indistinguishable from one made in nature. So, synthetic elements = elements

“Synthetic” doesn’t actually mean anything. We call “synthetic” any product that has been produced by human beings, and in the case of elements, that do not actually appear in nature (that we know of). However anything “synthetic” is equivalent to its “natural” form, just as 5 is 5, regardless of it being the result of 2+3 (nature) or 1+4 (humans, which, by the way are part of nature anyway) .
Synthetic or not the substance is still a element. An element is s substance which cannot be chemically broken into other substances, but there can be several types of the same element- isotopes.
